009package imagingbook.common.ij;
010
011import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
012import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
013import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
014import java.lang.annotation.Target;
015import java.lang.reflect.Field;
016import java.util.ArrayList;
017import java.util.List;
018
019import ij.ImagePlus;
020import ij.WindowManager;
021import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
022import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
023import imagingbook.core.resource.ImageResource;
024
025/**
026 * Utility methods and annotations related to ImageJ's {@link GenericDialog} class.
027 * 
028 * @author WB
029 * @version 2022/09/14 transfered annotations and dialog-related methods from {@link ParameterBundle}
030 */
031public abstract class DialogUtils {
032        
033        private DialogUtils() {}
034        
035        /**
036         * Annotation to specify a specific 'label' (value) to be shown for following
037         * parameter fields. Default label is the variable name.
038         * Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle} fields.
039         */
040        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
041        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
042        public static @interface DialogLabel {
043                public String value();
044        }
045
046        /**
047         * Annotation to specify the number of digits (value) displayed when showing
048         * numeric values in dialogs.
049         * This annotation has no effect on non-floating-point fields.
050         * Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle} fields.
051         */
052        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
053        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
054        public static @interface DialogDigits {
055                public int value();
056        }
057        
058        /**
059         * Annotation to specify the number of "columns" (value) displayed when showing
060         * string items in dialogs.
061         * This annotation has no effect on non-string fields.
062         * Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle} fields.
063         */
064        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
065        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
066        public static @interface DialogStringColumns {
067                public int value();
068        }
069
070
071        /**
072         * Annotation to hide the following parameter field in dialogs.
073         * Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle} fields.
074         */
075        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
076        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
077        public static @interface DialogHide {
078        }
079
080        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
081        
082        /**
083         * Creates a HTML string by formatting the supplied strings
084         * as individual text lines separated by {@literal <br>}.
085         * The complete text is wrapped by {@literal <html>...</html>}.
086         * Mainly to be used with {@link GenericDialog#addHelp(String)}.
087         * 
088         * @param lines a sequence of strings interpreted as text lines
089         * @return a HTML string
090         */
091        public static String makeHtmlString(CharSequence... lines) {
092                return "<html>\n" + String.join("<br>\n", lines) + "\n</html>";
093        }
094        
095        /**
096         * Creates a string by formatting the supplied strings
097         * as individual text lines separated by newline.
098         * Mainly to be used with {@link GenericDialog#addMessage(String)}.
099         * 
100         * @param lines a sequence of strings interpreted as text lines
101         * @return a newline-separated string
102         */
103        public static String makeLineSeparatedString(CharSequence... lines) {
104                return String.join("\n", lines);
105        }
106        
107        // ------------ Methods related to ParameterBundle  ------------------
108        
109        static Field[] getDialogFields(ParameterBundle<?> params) {
110                Class<?> clazz = params.getClass();
111                List<Field> dialogFields = new ArrayList<>();
112                for (Field f : clazz.getFields()) {
113                        if (isValidDialogField(f)) {
114                                dialogFields.add(f);
115                        }
116                }
117                return dialogFields.toArray(new Field[0]);
118        }
119        
120        /**
121         * Adds all qualified fields of the given {@link ParameterBundle} to the specified
122         * {@link GenericDialog} instance, in the exact order of their definition.
123         * Qualified means that the field is of suitable type and no 
124         * {@link DialogUtils.DialogHide} annotation is present.
125         * Allowed field types are {@code boolean}, {@code int}, {@code long}, {@code float},
126         * {@code double}, {@code enum}, and {@code String}.
127         * 
128         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
129         * @param gd a generic dialog
130         */
131        public static void addToDialog(ParameterBundle<?> params, GenericDialog gd) {
132                Field[] dialogFields = getDialogFields(params);         // gets only public fields
133                for (Field f : dialogFields) {
134                        if (!isValidDialogField(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogHide.class)) {
135                                continue;
136                        }
137                        try {
138                                addFieldToDialog(params, f, gd);
139                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) {
140                                throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // TODO: refine exception handling!
141                        }
142                }
143        }
144        
145//      public static void addToDialog(ParameterBundle params, GenericDialog gd) {
146//              Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = params.getClass();
147//              Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
148//              for (Field f : fields) {
149//                      if (!isValidDialogField(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogUtils.DialogHide.class)) {
150//                              continue;
151//                      }
152//                      try {
153//                              addFieldToDialog(params, f, gd);
154//                      } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) {
155//                              throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // TODO: refine exception handling!
156//                      }
157//              }
158//      }
159        
160        /**
161         * Retrieves the field values of the specified {@link ParameterBundle} from
162         * the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
163         * The {@link ParameterBundle} is modified. 
164         * Throws an exception if anything goes wrong.
165         * 
166         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
167         * @param gd a generic dialog
168         * @return true if successful
169         */
170        public static boolean getFromDialog(ParameterBundle<?> params, GenericDialog gd) {
171                Class<?> clazz = params.getClass();
172                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
173                int errorCount = 0;
174                for (Field f : fields) {
175                        if (!isValidDialogField(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogHide.class)) {
176                                continue;
177                        }
178                        try {
179                                if (!getFieldFromDialog(params, f, gd)) {
180                                        errorCount++;
181                                }
182                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { 
183                                throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage()); // TODO: refine exception handling!
184                        }
185                }
186                return (errorCount == 0);
187        }
188        
189        /**
190         * Adds the specified {@link Field} of this object as new item to 
191         * the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
192         * The name of the field is used as the 'label' of the dialog item
193         * unless a {@link DialogLabel} annotation is present.
194         * Allowed field types are {@code boolean}, {@code int}, {@code float},
195         * {@code double}, {@code enum}, and {@code String}.
196         * 
197         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
198         * @param field some field
199         * @param dialog the dialog
200         * @throws IllegalAccessException when field is accessed illegally
201         */
202        private static void addFieldToDialog(ParameterBundle<?> params, Field field, GenericDialog dialog)
203                        throws IllegalAccessException {
204                
205                String name = field.getName();
206                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogLabel.class)) {
207                        name = field.getAnnotation(DialogLabel.class).value();
208                }
209                
210                int digits = 2; // DefaultDialogDigits;
211                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogDigits.class)) {
212                        digits = field.getAnnotation(DialogDigits.class).value();
213                        digits = Math.max(0,  digits);
214                }
215                
216                int stringColumns = 8;
217                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogStringColumns.class)) {
218                        stringColumns = 
219                                        Math.max(stringColumns, field.getAnnotation(DialogStringColumns.class).value());
220                }
221                
222                Class<?> clazz = field.getType();
223                if  (clazz.equals(boolean.class)) {
224                        dialog.addCheckbox(name, field.getBoolean(params));
225                }
226                else if (clazz.equals(int.class)) {
227                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getInt(params), 0);
228                }
229                else if (clazz.equals(long.class)) {
230                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getLong(params), 0);
231                }
232                else if (clazz.equals(float.class)) {
233                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getFloat(params), digits);
234                }
235                else if (clazz.equals(double.class)) {
236                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getDouble(params), digits);
237                }
238                else if (clazz.equals(String.class)) {
239                        String str = (String) field.get(params);
240                        dialog.addStringField(name, str, stringColumns);
241                }
242                else if (clazz.isEnum()) {
243                        dialog.addEnumChoice(name, (Enum<?>) field.get(params));
244                }
245                else {
246                        // ignore this field
247                        //throw new RuntimeException("cannot handle field of type " + clazz);
248                }
249        }
250
251        /**
252         * Modifies the specified {@link Field} of this object by reading the next item
253         * from the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
254         * 
255         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
256         * @param field a publicly accessible {@link Field} of this object 
257         * @param gd a {@link GenericDialog} instance
258         * @return true if successful
259         * @throws IllegalAccessException illegal field access
260         */
261        @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
262        private static boolean getFieldFromDialog(ParameterBundle params, Field field, GenericDialog gd)
263                                        throws IllegalAccessException {
264                Class<?> clazz = field.getType();
265                if  (clazz.equals(boolean.class)) {
266                        field.setBoolean(params, gd.getNextBoolean());
267                }
268                else if (clazz.equals(int.class)) {
269                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
270                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
271                                return false;
272                        }
273                        field.setInt(params, (int) val);
274                }
275                else if (clazz.equals(long.class)) {
276                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
277                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
278                                return false;
279                        }
280                        field.setLong(params, (long) val);
281                }
282                else if (clazz.equals(float.class)) {
283                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
284                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
285                                return false;
286                        }
287                        field.setFloat(params, (float) val);
288                }
289                else if (clazz.equals(double.class)) {
290                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
291                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
292                                return false;
293                        }
294                        field.setDouble(params, val);
295                }
296                else if (clazz.equals(String.class)) {
297                        String str = gd.getNextString();
298                        if (str == null) {
299                                return false;
300                        }
301                        field.set(params, str);
302                }
303                else if (clazz.isEnum()) {
304                        Enum en = gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<Enum>) clazz);
305                        if (en == null) {
306                                return false;
307                        }
308                        field.set(params, en);
309//                      field.set(instance, gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<? extends Enum>) clazz));       // works                        
310//                      field.set(instance, gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<Enum>) clazz)); // works        
311                }
312                else {
313                        // ignore this field
314                        // throw new RuntimeException("cannot handle field of type " + clazz);
315                }
316                return true;
317        }
318        
319        private static boolean isValidDialogField(Field f) {
320                if (!ParameterBundle.isValidParameterField(f)) {
321                        return false;
322                }
323//              int mod = f.getModifiers();
324//              if (Modifier.isPrivate(mod) || Modifier.isFinal(mod) || Modifier.isStatic(mod)) {
325//                      return false;
326//              }
327                // accept only certain field types in dialogs:
328                Class<?> clazz = f.getType();
329                return (clazz == boolean.class || clazz == int.class || clazz == long.class || 
330                                clazz == float.class   || clazz == double.class || 
331                                clazz == String.class  || clazz.isEnum());
332        }
333        
334        // various static methods for simple dialogs -------------------------------

346//      }
347        
348        /**
349         * Opens a simple dialog with the specified title and message that allows
350         * only a "Yes" or "Cancel" response.
351         * 
352         * @param title the text displayed in the dialog's title bar
353         * @param message the dialog message (may be multiple lines separated by newlines)
354         * @return true if "yes" was selected, false otherwise 
355         */
356        @Deprecated
357        public static boolean askYesOrCancel(String title, String message) {
358                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(title);
359                gd.addMessage(message);
360                gd.enableYesNoCancel("Yes", "Cancel");
361                gd.hideCancelButton();
362                gd.showDialog();
363                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
364                        return false;
365                }
366                return gd.wasOKed();
367        }
368
369        /**
370         * Opens a very specific dialog asking if the suggested sample image (resource) should be opened and made the active
371         * image. If the answer is YES, the suggested image is opened, otherwise not. This if typically used in the
372         * (otherwise empty) constructor of demo plugins when no (or no suitable) image is currently open.
373         *
374         * @param suggested a sample image ({@link ImageResource})
375         * @return true if user accepted
376         */
377        public static boolean askForSampleImage(ImageResource suggested) {      // TODO: allow multiple sample images?
378                String title = "Open sample image";
379                String message = "No image is currently open.\nUse a sample image?\n";
380                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(title);
381                gd.setInsets(0, 0, 0);
382                gd.addMessage(message);
383
384                if (suggested != null) {
385                        gd.setInsets(10, 10, 10);
386                        gd.addImage(suggested.getImageIcon());
387                }
388
389                gd.enableYesNoCancel("Yes", "Cancel");
390                gd.hideCancelButton();
391                gd.showDialog();
392                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
393                        return false;
394                }
395
396                boolean ok = gd.wasOKed();
397                if (ok && suggested != null) {
398                        ImagePlus im = suggested.getImagePlus();
399                        im.show();
400                        WindowManager.setCurrentWindow(im.getWindow());
401                }
402                return ok;
403        }
404        
405        public static boolean askForSampleImage() {
406                return askForSampleImage(null);
407        }
408
